items.sentence: I don\'t know if I should turn left or right.
I don\'t know if Tom is in the office or not.
I don\'t know what Tom is doing in Australia.
I don\'t think that Tom knows how to do that.
Are you sure you don\'t want to swim with us?
Are you sure you don\'t want to wait for Tom?
Are you sure you really don\'t need anything?
Tom has everything a boy could possibly want.
Tom has just told me that he found a new job.
Tom has known Mary since he was a little boy.
Tom has lived alone ever since his wife died.
Tom has lost his interest in studying French.
Tom won\'t be able to answer those questions.
You\'re either with me or you\'re against me.
I\'ve learned a lot about astronomy from Tom.
I\'ve read thirteen books so far this summer.
No matter what I do, I can\'t make Tom laugh.
You\'ve got to go even if you don\'t want to.
I think you hate Tom as much as he hates you.
I think you might need to learn how to drive.
